node.title: Twenty-year-old former Hong Kong independence leader gets more than three years jail for secession
node.alt: Former Studentlocalism leader Tony Chung wears glasses and looks at the camera as coloured lights shine in the background.
node.description: Tony Chung was an independence leader in Hong Kong who now at 20 years of age will spend more than three years in prison under the national security law.
node.content:
["The former leader of Hong Kong pro-independence group Studentlocalism has been sentenced to\u00a043 months in prison on charges of secession and money laundering.", "Tony Chung, 20, was charged on Tuesday\u00a0under Hong Kong's\u00a0sweeping national security law and was denied bail.", "Mr Chung was originally detained in October 2020\u00a0along with two others near the US\u00a0consulate, before he could make a bid for asylum.\u00a0", "Mr Chung entered into a plea deal, admitting guilt on the charge of secession and one count of money laundering.", "The plea reduced his sentence down\u00a0to 40 months for the secession charge and 18 months for money laundering, but only three months of the latter charge will be served separately \u2014 resulting in a total sentence of 43 months.", "", "
The prosecutor said Mr Chung ran the Facebook pages of two pro-independence groups.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Tyrone Siu)
", "District Court Judge Stanley Chan said Mr Chung \"actively organised, planned and implemented activities to separate the country\".", "Prosecutor Ivan Cheung said the defendant acted as an administrator for the Facebook pages of the US\u00a0branch of Studentlocalism and\u00a0the Initiative Independence Party.", "Pro-independence T-shirts, flags and books were also seized from his home, Mr Cheung said.", "The money laundering charge related to donations he received via PayPal.", "Like many other anti-government organisations, Studentlocalism disbanded before Beijing imposed the security law on Hong Kong\u00a0in June 2020.", "The law punishes anything Beijing deems as subversion, secession, terrorism or collusion with foreign forces with up to life in prison.", "Since the enactment of the security law, Hong Kong has taken a swift authoritarian turn, with most democratic politicians now in jail or in self-exile.", "Dozens of civil society organisations have folded, and\u00a0some international rights groups have left the city.", "Chinese and Hong Kong authorities deny the security law impedes individual rights and say the legislation was necessary to restore stability after mass street protests in 2019.", "The former British colony returned to Chinese rule in 1997 with the promise of a high degree of autonomy.", "Democracy activists and some Western governments say China broke that promise \u2014\u00a0an allegation that Beijing vehemently denies.", "Reuters"]
